page.title: 08INTERVIEW WITH SOME LOCALS
page.content: ON THE 9TH JULY 1985,I INTERVIEWED SOME{DINNER LADIES OF BROADWEY} {SCHOOL.}WHILST TALKING TO THEM I FOUND THAT THEY HAD BEEN LIVING IN UPWEY FOR MOST OF THEIR LIVES AND THAT A LOT OF THE SHOPPING FACILITIES HAD GONE. INCLUDING A POST OFFICE,THE BUTCHERS,THE GROCERS,AND THE PUBLIC HOUSE CALLED THE ROYAL OAK. A FINE EXAMPLE OF HOW THE USE OF PREMISES HAS CHANGED IS A BUILDING IN ELWELL STREET WHICH USED TO BE A PROVISIONS SHOP,THEN IT WAS A FISH AND CHIP SHOP,THEN IT WAS A BARBERS SHOP AND IS NOW A NORMAL RESIDENTIAL HOUSE. RECENTLY DORCHESTER ROAD HAS BEEN WIDENED EXTENSIVELY TO IMPROVE ACCESS ALL ALONG ITS LENGTH.
